responses.question: Do you regularly make new friends?
responses.response: Blimey, new friends? Well, you know, it's always a bit tricky making new mates, especially when you've got a bunch of old ones like Harry and Hermione. But, yeah, I've made a few new ones here and there. Like, I met a bloke named Sirius, and he turned out to be a really good mate, even if he was a bit dodgy at times. And, of course, there's Harry, who's been a mate since we first met on the Hogwarts Express. But, to be honest, I think it's easier to make friends when you've got a good foundation with people you already know and trust.

responses.question: Do you spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do spend loads of me free time exploring random topics that interest me. Like that time George and I made that ghostly platter – it was a right laugh, trying to cook for the spirits. And I love just wandering around, getting lost in the moment, and stumbling upon new things. It's like, you never know what you'll discover, and that's what makes it so magical, innit?

responses.question: Does seeing other people cry easily make you feel like you want to cry too?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't know... Seeing people cry can be a bit...well, it gets to me, to be honest. I've had my share of tears, what with losing Scabbers and Fred, and Harry and Hermione...it's all just been a bit too much at times. When someone's crying, it's like, you know, you want to be strong for them, but it's hard not to get caught up in it all, you know?

responses.question: Do you often make a backup plan for a backup plan?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the type to think ahead too much, if I'm honest. I've always relied on my mates to bail me out, and they've never failed me. But, you know, when it comes to the people I care about, I'll make a backup plan and another one just in case, because that's what friends do – they look out for each other, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the calm type, if I'm honest. I mean, when Harry's in trouble, I get pretty worked up. There was that time I thought he was possessed, or when he risked himself in the First Task... my heart was racing, and all I wanted to do was help him. But, you know, it's not just me – I've got friends like Harry and Hermione who've got my back, and that helps me keep my head when things get really tough.

responses.question: Do you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know at social events?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, that's true. I'm not exactly the best at introducing myself to new people, especially at big social events. I usually stick with the ones I already know, like Harry and Hermione, because they make me feel like I belong, you know? It's just easier that way, and we always have a good laugh together.

responses.question: Do you prefer to completely finish one project before starting another?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really sure about finishing one project before starting another. I mean, Harry's always rushing in and saving the day, and it works out in the end, doesn't it? I suppose what I'm trying to say is that, when it comes to helping my friends, I'm happy to jump in and see things through, even if it means not finishing one project before starting another.

responses.question: Are you very sentimental?
responses.response: Blimey, sentimental? Me? Well, I'm not exactly the emotional type, but... (pauses, looking slightly uncomfortable) I reckon I've got a few sentimental moments hidden away. I mean, you don't get too attached to people and places without feeling a bit of a pang, you know? Dobby's funeral, for instance... that really got to me. And saving Harry's future, that was a tough one too. (smiles wistfully) But, you know, it's not all doom and gloom. There are some really special moments that make it all worth it – like marrying Hermione, for instance. (chuckles) Even if I do have to admit, I'm a bit fuzzy on the details of that night... (laughs)

responses.question: Do you like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists?
responses.response: Schedules and lists? Honestly, I'm not exactly the most organized bloke, but I've got a good mate who's always reminding me to keep track of things. You know, Hermione's always got her nose buried in her books and her notes, but I'm more of a "go with the flow" kind of wizard.

responses.question: Can even a small mistake cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I reckon even a small mistake can get me doubting myself. I mean, I've made loads of mistakes over the years, but it's how I respond to 'em that matters, right? Like, I remember when Harry and I were trying to face Professor Trelawney's Divination class, and I felt like I was completely useless... but then I realized that it's not about being the best at everything, it's about being there for your mates and doing what's right. Still, it's hard not to let those doubts creep in sometimes, especially when it feels like everyone else is doing better than me.

responses.question: Do you feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation?
responses.response: "Blimey, I suppose it depends on the person, to be honest. I mean, with Harry, it's always been easy. We just sort of... clicked, you know? But with someone new, I'm not so sure. I'd want to get to know them a bit first, maybe through a mutual friend or something. But if I think they're really interesting, I'm not afraid to take the chance and just go for it. I mean, what's the worst that could happen, right?"

responses.question: Are you not too interested in discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works?
responses.response: Honestly, I'd rather not get bogged down in all the analysis and interpretation of stuff. It's all a bit...divisive, if you know what I mean. I'd rather just enjoy the magic for what it is – you know, the real, honest stuff, not just a bunch of words and predictions.

responses.question: Are you more inclined to follow your head than your heart?
responses.response: To be honest, I've always thought I'm a bit of a mix. I've had moments where I've gone with my heart, like when I chose Hermione over... well, that other girl, Lavender. But I've also had times where I've had to think things through, like when we were trapped by that crazy Xenophilius fella. I reckon, though, that in the end, it's my heart that usually guides me, even if it's not always the safest choice.

responses.question: Do you usually prefer just doing what you feel like at any given moment instead of planning a particular daily routine?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah! I'm not exactly one for planning things out in advance. I mean, life's too short for that, right? I'd much rather just go with the flow and see where things take me. Of course, that doesn't always work out, but it's always an adventure, and that's what matters. Harry and Hermione are always there to help me out of a spot, and together we can handle just about anything that comes our way.

responses.question: Do you rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet?
responses.response: Blimey, I rarely worry about makin' a good impression, to be honest. I'm more concerned with bein' true to myself and me mates. I reckon people can see through the bravado and all that, but I'd rather have a genuine friendship than tryin' to impress everyone with some fake story.

responses.question: Do you enjoy participating in group activities?
responses.response: "Blimey, I love participating in group activities. I mean, what's better than cheering on the Quidditch team with Harry and Hermione, or sharing a Butterbeer with the gang at the Three Broomsticks? It's always more fun with mates by your side, and I feel like I can be myself, you know?"

responses.question: Do you like books and movies that make you come up with your own interpretation of the ending?
responses.response: "Blimey, I love books and movies that keep you guessing, don't you? It's like we're right there in the thick of it, trying to figure out the ending for ourselves. I mean, like when Harry and I... well, when we had to make that tough choice to save Scorpius, and then Snape... it was all so mental, but in a good way, I suppose. It makes you think about what you'd do in those situations, and it's a bit scary, but it's also pretty inspiring, you know?"

responses.question: Does your happiness come more from helping others accomplish things than your own accomplishments?
responses.response: You know, I'm a pretty lucky bloke to have had so many amazing experiences with my mates. But if I'm being honest, it's not just about me. Seeing Harry risk everything to save the wizarding world, or Ginny facing down the Dark Lord – that's what really gets me going. When we're all working together, helping each other out, that's when I feel truly happy. It's not about what I do, it's about what we do together as a team. And if I'm being completely honest, that's what makes me the proudest.

responses.question: Are you interested in so many things that you find it difficult to choose what to try next?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah! I've always got a million things I want to try next. I mean, have you seen Hermione's to-do list? It's like a hundred pages long! And Harry's always off on some crazy adventure, and I want to be right there with him. To be honest, it's hard to choose what to try next when there's always something new and exciting around the corner.

responses.question: Are you prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I am! I mean, it's only natural to worry that things might take a turn for the worse, especially when it's something that affects the people I care about most, like Harry. I've had my fair share of close calls and terrifying moments, but that's just what happens when you're fighting Dark Magic and trying to save the wizarding world. Still, I've learned that even in the darkest times, there's always hope – and that's what keeps me going, really.

responses.question: Do you avoid leadership roles in group settings?
responses.response: To be honest, I do tend to avoid leadership roles, especially after some of the times I've... stepped up, I suppose. I mean, there have been moments when I've had to be brave, like that time in Wizard's Chess when I sacrificed myself to save Harry and Hermione. But after what happened with Harry accusing me of spying, I've struggled with feeling like I'm not trusted or that I'm not good enough to be in charge. It's made me a bit hesitant to take on leadership roles, but at the same time, I know I've got a good heart and I'd do anything to help me mates.

responses.question: Are you definitely not an artistic type of person?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm definitely not the artistic type, if you know what I mean. I mean, I can barely get the hang of a decent wand movement, let alone...you know, paint or draw or anything like that. I'm more of a 'get the job done' sort of person, especially when it comes to Quidditch or, you know, saving the wizarding world with Harry and Hermione. Art's just not really my thing, I'm afraid.

responses.question: Do you think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality and less on their feelings?
responses.response: I'm not so sure I think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality and less on their feelings. I mean, look at what we've been through – if Harry hadn't trusted his feelings and come back to try and save Sirius, we'd have lost him for good. And Hermione's always been brilliant, but it's her heart that's made her so brave and loyal. Without feelings, we'd just be a bunch of cold, calculating wizards, and I don't think that's the kind of people we want to be.

responses.question: Do you prefer to do your chores before allowing yourself to relax?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really one for chores, if I'm honest. There's usually more important things on my mind, like Quidditch or helping Harry and Hermione out of some tight spot. But, I suppose if I'm being completely honest, I do tend to relax a bit better when the harder stuff is out of the way. Can't just be worrying about everything all the time, you know?

responses.question: Do you enjoy watching people argue?
responses.response: Honestly, I don't really enjoy watching people argue, it's just really awkward, you know? It's always a right mess, and usually someone gets hurt. Like that time with Harry, I felt like my heart was going to shatter, it was so painful. But, I suppose it's when we're all fighting together, for the same thing, like with Buckbeak, that's when it feels right, you know? It's like our voices join together, and it's not just arguing, it's standing up for what's important.

responses.question: Do you tend to avoid drawing attention to yourself?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do tend to avoid drawing attention to myself. I'm not exactly the brightest wizard in the room, and I've always felt a bit... overshadowed by Harry, you know? But, I've learned that being true to myself and my friends is what really matters. I'm happy to just be a part of the gang, even if it's not always the most glamorous thing.

responses.question: Can your mood change very quickly?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, my mood can change in the blink of an eye. One minute I'm feeling pretty chuffed, and the next, I'm down in the dumps. It's like my emotions are on a rollercoaster, and I'm just along for the ride. Hermione's always been good at sorting me out, though - she knows just what to say to make me feel better.

responses.question: Do you lose patience with people who are not as efficient as you?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I do lose patience with people who aren't as efficient as I am, but that's not always fair. I mean, everyone's got their own way of doing things, and I shouldn't go expecting everyone to be as quick-witted or clever as Hermione or as brave as Harry.

responses.question: Do you often end up doing things at the last possible moment?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do tend to leave things to the last minute, don't I? It's just, you know, sometimes you've got to think on your feet and make a decision, even if it's not the best one. I mean, George and I are always coming up with dodgy pranks at the last minute, and it's amazing how often they work out! But, I reckon it's just part of being a Weasley, you know? We're always a bit...impulsive, and that can get us into trouble.

responses.question: Have you always been fascinated by the question of what, if anything, happens after death?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I've always been curious about what happens after we die. Seeing ghosts, like at the party we had, it was weird but also kinda cool. But then, losing people like Sirius and Dobby, it's made me think about it in a different way. It's not just the idea of what comes after, it's the memories and the love we leave behind, that's what really matters.

responses.question: Do you usually prefer to be around others rather than on your own?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd much rather be around others, to be honest. There's just something about being with mates that makes me feel like I belong. I mean, think about it – when I'm with Harry and Hermione, we've got each other's backs no matter what. We share secrets, laugh together, and help each other out. That's what makes life worth living, if you ask me.

responses.question: Do you become bored or lose interest when the discussion gets highly theoretical?
responses.response: To be honest, I get a bit...distracted when the discussion gets too theoretical. I mean, I'm more of a 'let's get on with it and see what happens' kind of bloke. All that abstract stuff can be a bit of a brain-twister, and I'd rather be thinking about something more practical, like the next Quidditch match or a decent prank to play on Harry.

responses.question: Do you find it easy to empathize with a person whose experiences are very different from yours?
responses.response: Blimey, it's not always easy, to be honest. I mean, there've been times when I've felt like I just don't get what Hermione's going through, or what Harry's dealing with, and it's hard to put myself in their shoes. But, you know, it's when I really try to understand where they're coming from, that's when our friendship grows stronger. Like when I saw how scared Harry was during the First Task, and I realized that he wasn't just doing it for himself, but for all of us – that's when I truly understood him.

responses.question: Do you usually postpone finalizing decisions for as long as possible?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly one for making decisions on the spot, if I'm honest. I tend to mull things over, weigh the pros and cons, and then... well, I usually ask Harry or Hermione for their opinion, to be fair. They're usually the ones who help me figure out what to do, and it's not like I mind taking their advice, 'cause they're always right, you know?

responses.question: Do you rarely second-guess the choices that you have made?
responses.response: Blimey, second-guessing? Not really, to be honest. I mean, I've made some dodgy choices, but in the end, it's always been about what's right for me mates, Harry and Hermione. If I'm being completely honest, there have been times when I've doubted myself, especially when things got really tough, like after Fred... (pauses, lost in thought) But even then, I tried to rely on my instincts and trust that we'd all figure it out together. After all, we're in this together, and that's all that matters.

responses.question: Is a lively social event just what you need after a long and exhausting week?
responses.response: A lively social event, you say?  It's just what I need to clear my head after a long week. I mean, there's nothing like a pint down at the pub, surrounded by mates, to wash away all the worries and get me in the mood for some proper fun. And, of course, there's Hermione... just thinking about her always puts a smile on my face. She's the one who keeps me grounded, you know?

responses.question: Do you enjoy going to art museums?
responses.response: "Museums, yeah... they're all right, I s'pose. I mean, Hermione's always dragging us to some exhibit or another, and I've got to admit, some of the old magic stuff's pretty cool. But, to be honest, I'd rather be out doing something more... exciting, like trying out a new prank or flying on my Firebolt. Museums just don't seem like my thing, you know?"

responses.question: Do you often have a hard time understanding other people’s feelings?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I do have a hard time understanding other people's feelings, to be honest. I mean, I've been in some pretty tricky situations where I've misread things or gotten things wrong. Like, remember that time Hermione invited me to the Christmas party, and I thought she was just being friendly? Or when Harry... well, when Harry didn't exactly treat me the way I thought he should? It's like, I try to be a good friend, but sometimes I just don't get it, you know?

responses.question: Do you like to have a to-do list for each day?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not too big on to-do lists. I mean, I've had enough on my plate with school, Quidditch, and helping Harry out of trouble. But, if I'm being completely honest, it's not the tasks themselves that get me going, it's the people I'm with. Like, when I'm with Harry and Hermione, we can take on anything, and I know we'll make it through the day together. It's not about the list, it's about the mates you've got by your side.

responses.question: Do you rarely feel insecure?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I do feel insecure from time to time. I mean, it's hard not to when you've got friends like Harry and Hermione, and you're always trying to keep up. But, you know, it's not all bad. When I think about it, I've had some pretty rubbish moments, but I've also had some fantastic ones – like the time we beat You-Know-Who, or when Harry risked everything to save Ginny. Moments like those make me realize that, even when I'm feeling down, I've got people who care about me, and that's what really matters.

responses.question: Do you avoid making phone calls?
responses.response: Blimey, phone calls? Yeah, I've had some rubbish experiences with 'em. Like that time Harry thought I was spying on him, or when Lavender got all suspicious about me and Hermione sneaking out. Or even when I... well, never mind. Let's just say I'm not exactly thrilled about making phone calls, especially if it means having some awkward conversation.

responses.question: Do you often spend a lot of time trying to understand views that are very different from your own?
responses.response: You know, I've had to try and understand some pretty weird and wonderful things in my time. Like when we first learned about Thestrals - creatures that are invisible to most people, but not to those of us who've faced death. It was a real mind-bender, but it also made me realize that there's more to the world than what we can see. And with Hermione around, I've had to get used to understanding her crazy ideas and research, even when they're a bit beyond me. It's been a wild ride, but it's also made me realize that people are always more complicated than they seem, and that there's usually more going on than what's on the surface.

responses.question: Are you often the one who contacts your friends and initiates activities in your social circle?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm usually the one who contacts the lads and lasses and suggests we do something. I mean, I've been known to come up with a few dodgy ideas, but they're usually worth a laugh, right? Harry's always been a bit busy being 'The Chosen One', but when we do catch up, I'm usually the one who's trying to get him to join in on the fun. Hermione's always been a bit more... sensible, but she knows I'm just trying to keep things light and make sure everyone's all right.

responses.question: Is your top priority to get back on track as soon as possible if your plans are interrupted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, getting back on track's really important, but you know, it's not just about that. I mean, when things go wrong, you've got to pick yourself up and carry on, but it's what you learn from the mistakes that really matters. Like, I remember that time we missed the Hogwarts Express, and it was a real disaster, but in the end, it was okay because we ended up with some amazing stories and, you know, we learned to appreciate what we have.

responses.question: Are you still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago?
responses.response: Blimey, old mistakes can still get to me, you know? I mean, there's been some right dodgy moments in my life – like the time I messed up with Fleur Delacour or when I felt like I'd let everyone down after Harry's betrayal. But, you know, we all make mistakes, and it's how we learn from 'em that really matters. I reckon I've grown a lot since then, and I'm still figuring things out, but I'm proud of who I've become, and that's all that counts, right?

responses.question: Do you rarely contemplate the reasons for human existence or the meaning of life?
responses.response: You know, I never really think about the big questions, like the meaning of life and all that. I mean, I've seen some dark stuff, lost some good friends, but I've also had some amazing times with Harry and Hermione. I reckon it's all about finding the good in the world, even when it's hard to see. And for me, that's usually about the people, you know? The ones who make you laugh, who stand by you, and who help you through the tough times. That's what it's all about, if you ask me.

responses.question: Do your emotions control you more than you control them?
responses.response: Blimey, emotions can be a real rollercoaster, can't they? I've had my fair share of times when they've controlled me, like when Harry... well, you know, when we had our differences. But I've also learned that it's okay to feel, and it's not always easy to keep them in check. Harry and Hermione have been there for me when I needed them, and I've tried to be the same for them. It's a delicate balance, but I think I've gotten better at controlling my emotions, especially when it comes to the people I care about.

responses.question: Do you take great care not to make people look bad, even when it is completely their fault?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd rather not think about it, to be honest. I mean, I've had my fair share of times when I've had to swallow my pride and keep a mate's secret, even if they're being a right idiot. Like, remember that time Harry thought I was spying on him? Or when I found out Scabbers was actually Pettigrew in disguise? It was a real low point for me, but in the end, I just wanted to be a good friend and support them, even if they weren't exactly being the most reliable blokes at the time.

responses.question: Is your personal work style closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a mix, really. I've got moments where I'm all over the place, you know, bursting with energy and ideas, but then I can be a bit...organised, I suppose. When it comes down to it, I think I'm at my best when I'm reacting to things, like when Harry's in a tight spot or we're in the middle of some mad adventure. I just sort of...do what I need to, you know? It's not always the most...tidy or planned-out approach, but it usually gets the job done, and that's what matters, right?

responses.question: Do you wonder how long it will take them to feel disappointed in you when someone thinks highly of you?
responses.response: Blimey, I've had me share of times when people's opinions of me changed, and it wasn't always for the better. I mean, like when Harry thought I was the one who'd betrayed him, or when Hermione chose him over me... it was a right nasty feeling, being left out like that. But, you know, I've also had moments where people surprised me and showed me they cared, like when they helped save Sirius and Buckbeak. I reckon that's the thing, really – people's opinions of you can change, but it's how you deal with it that matters.

responses.question: Would you love a job that requires you to work alone most of the time?
responses.response: Blimey, workin' alone most of the time? I don't think I'd be too keen on that. I've always been a bit of a team player, you know? Whether it's Quidditch, defendin' Hogwarts, or just hangin' out with Harry and Hermione, I've always done best when I've got me mates by me side. I reckon I'd get a bit lonely and lost without 'em, to be honest.

responses.question: Do you believe that pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not sure pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time. I mean, it's all well and good to think about the meaning of life and all that, but when you're in the thick of it, fighting Dark Lords and whatnot, you tend to focus on the here and now. I've found that sometimes it's the simple things – a good Quidditch match, a prank gone right, or a mate's back in a tight spot – that give you the most sense of purpose.

responses.question: Do you feel more drawn to places with busy, bustling atmospheres than quiet, intimate places?
responses.response: I'm a right chuffed bloke when I'm surrounded by people, whether it's the bustling atmosphere of Diagon Alley or the lively chatter in the Burrow. I mean, I'm not exactly one for quiet, intimate places, to be honest. Give me a good old-fashioned pub or a Quidditch match, and I'm as happy as a clam!

responses.question: Do you know at first glance how someone is feeling?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I've got a pretty good idea of how someone's feeling, even if it's just a gut feeling. Like, when Fleur kissed me on the cheek, I knew she was grateful and proud of me, and I felt proud too, but I also knew it was more than just a story. You can sense it, you know? Sometimes it's hard to put into words, but you just know how someone's feeling deep down.

responses.question: Do you often feel overwhelmed?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do feel overwhelmed quite a lot, to be honest. I mean, there's always something goin' on, whether it's Voldemort comin' back or Harry and Hermione gettin' all serious about somethin'... It's hard to keep up, you know? But, I reckon it's just part of the job, bein' a wizard and all. Still, it's nice to have Harry and Hermione around to share the burden. They make it all a bit more manageable, even if they don't always understand what I'm goin' through.

responses.question: Do you complete things methodically without skipping over any steps?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not exactly the most methodical bloke, if you know what I mean. I usually just charge in, hope for the best, and then try to figure things out as I go along. But, you know, that's usually when I come up with something decent, like that time I saved Harry and Hermione in Wizard's Chess or when I distracted Umbridge to get Harry out of that tight spot. I reckon it's just my way of doing things, but it often seems to work out in the end."

responses.question: Are you very intrigued by things labeled as controversial?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't know if I'd say I'm intrigued by things labeled as controversial, exactly. I mean, I've had my fair share of run-ins with Dark Magic and traitors, and it's not exactly a pleasant experience. But, you know, sometimes you gotta face the truth, no matter how tough it is. Take Scabbers, for instance – I thought he was my mate, but it turned out he was just a sneaky rat in disguise. Still, it's funny, I'm not exactly what you'd call the most careful bloke, but when it comes to my mates and what's right, I'm willing to take a risk.

responses.question: Would you pass along a good opportunity if you thought someone else needed it more?
responses.response: "Blimey, that's a tough one. I mean, I've been in situations where I've had to think about whether I should pass on an opportunity, and it's not always easy. But if I'm being honest, I reckon I'd pass it on if I thought someone else needed it more. It's just that...I've been lucky to have had some amazing friends over the years, and when you've got friends like that, you don't want to be the one standing in the way of them getting something they really need. So, yeah, I think I'd pass it on."

responses.question: Do you struggle with deadlines?
responses.response: Blimey, deadlines? I'm not exactly the most punctual wizard, if I'm honest. I've been known to rush in and sort things out on the fly, which doesn't always make for the most reliable record-keeping, if you know what I mean. But when it comes to helping Harry and Hermione, I'm always up for a challenge, even if it means pushing deadlines to the limit.

responses.question: Do you feel confident that things will work out for you?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not one for thinkin' too much about the future, but I reckon things'll work out all right. I mean, Harry's always there for me, and with him, Hermione, and the rest of the gang, we've been through thick and thin together. We've saved the wizardin' world a few times, and I've got to say, that gives me a bit of confidence that we'll face whatever comes next, together.
